record.dc:title: 169HA2 Davis Site 6HA2, Hamilton County, Tennessee. Feature 12, Rectangular post mold pattern, including molds, clay basin, and midden pit.
record.wpa:narrative: In S.E. corner post mold pattern was obliterated by later intrusive burial 6HA6. The floor was fragmentary, due to breakage by plow. Its origin, where certain, was the same depth as the postmolds - possibly as much as 0.2' higher. The association of floor and molds is not questioned. The midden pit has a burned clay lining on the northern edge.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution. See also photographs 167HA2 [fhm00783] and 168HA2 [fhm00784].
